benchmark_details.name: UA-GEC (Ukrainian Grammatical Error Correction Corpus)
benchmark_details.overview: This is the first Grammatical Error Correction (GEC) corpus for the Ukrainian language, professionally annotated for grammatical error correction and fluency edits. It was created from texts collected from diverse contributors, covering various writing domains, and is intended for developing and evaluating GEC systems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality corpus for grammatical error correction and fluency in the Ukrainian language.

data.source: The corpus is composed of texts collected from a pool of 492 unique contributors, including native and non-native speakers.
data.annotation: Annotated by professional proofreaders for grammar, spelling, punctuation, and fluency errors.

metrics: Accuracy rate based on inter-annotator agreement
methodology.calculation: Error rates are calculated based on the number of corrections made per 1000 tokens.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy rates indicate the quality of grammatical corrections in the data.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement evaluated with a sample of sentences to ensure quality.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The corpus includes demographic data for contributors based on gender, age, and native language.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is anonymized during collection to protect personal information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided informed consent during data collection.
